form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee (for himself, Mr. Cruz, and Mr. Paul) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To treat gold and silver coins used as legal tender in the same manner as United States currency for taxation purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sound Money Promotion Act.

section.header: Gold and silver coins that are legal tender not subject to taxation

subsection.text: Gold and silver coins declared legal tender by the Federal Government or any State government shall not be subject to taxation.

subsection.text: The provisions of, and amendments made by, this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
